intro: Taeniophyllum steenisii, commonly known as the slender green-rooted fern, is a rare tropical plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are often covered in a dense layer of soft, white hairs. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth in Southeast Asia. Its rhizome is slender and extensively branched, supporting the growth of its aerial fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
